Articles.Content:
My PC runing 1.7.3 very normal but on 1.8 and 1.8.1 it will stuck in the beginning of loading just show a little yellow bar and black screen , nothing else.

I'm reinstall a clear KSP 1.8.1 in steam with no mod. the issue still there.

I'm change the KSP directory and check read only the issue still there.

AppData\LocalLow\Squad\Kerbal Space Program\ no output.log file created.

My PC build:

CPU
    - AMD Ryzen 5 3600 6-Core Processor

GPU
    - NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1070 Ti 8 GB  441.41

RAM
    - 8 GB CRUCIAL @ 3733 MHz
    - 8 GB CRUCIAL @ 3733 MHz

Operating system
    - Microsoft Windows 10 专业版 64-bit 1909

Motherboard
    - ASUSTeK COMPUTER INC. PRIME B350-PLUS (AM4)

Storage
    - GLOWAY STK720GS3-S7 670 GB
    - NVMe SAMSUNG MZVPW256 SCSI Disk Device 239 GB
    - TOSHIBA HDWD130 2795 GB
    - WD Elements 1078 USB Device 1863 GB
    - ST2000DM006-2DM164 1864 GB

Optical drives

Audio
    - Realtek High Definition Audio
    - Logitech G633 Gaming Headset
    - NVIDIA Virtual Audio Device (Wave Extensible) (WDM)
    - NVIDIA High Definition Audio

Network
    - TP-LINK 802.11ac Network Adapter

Looks like you are using AMD so, You have the AMD compatibility mode enabled?

On 12/1/2019 at 4:31 AM, Rogerx said:

Uploading Crash Report
TimeZoneNotFoundException: Exception of type 'System.TimeZoneNotFoundException' was thrown.

Missing files, do a file validation and try again.

AMD compatibility mode in Launcher.exe already try. same issue

file validation is fine. 

I'm rollback to 1.73 wait for new version.

Mmm... are you, by any chance, in continental China ? (guessing from the Chinese characters), if so, it might be that the Timezone your computer is in is not known to KSP, maybe try to change it to another one (one of the CEST for instance). The TimeZoneNotFound is weird, but since it happens a lot, I think it's not the issue we're hunting for.

 

Instead,

Quote

NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
  at GameDatabase+<CreateDatabase>d__70.MoveNext () [0x000cd] in <9d71e4043e394d78a6cf9193ad011698>:0 
  at UnityEngine.SetupCoroutine.InvokeMoveNext (System.Collections.IEnumerator enumerator, System.IntPtr returnValueAddress) [0x00027] in <5aeafee3fea24f37abd1315553f2cfa6>:0 
 

is a more precise and interesting issue, it seems your game fails at creating a database of some kind. Do you have free space on your hard drive ?

It could also be a race condition: the game start a 'create database' task, then goes on its life, but tries to access the database before it is being created, because the database creation has been delayed or failed. The delay/failure might be the TimeZone exceptions.

So, maybe try to setup your computer on a different timezone (One of a huge city, to reduce the possibility of Unity not knowing about it).

Also, try installing the game in a new directory (not the same one in which you have 1.7.3), just to eliminate some weird upgrades issues.

Forget about that. I missed this part:

Quote

[SpaceNavigatorWindows]: Could not initialize device.
没有注册类

Google translate tells me that those characters means "No registered class". Which is weird.

Did you try to play in windowed mode instead of full screen ? If no, you might give it a try. The device will require less initialization in windowed mode I think.

On 12/1/2019 at 5:31 AM, Rogerx said:

 

My PC runing 1.7.3 very normal but on 1.8 and 1.8.1 it will stuck in the beginning of loading just show a little yellow bar and black screen , nothing else.

I'm reinstall a clear KSP 1.8.1 in steam with no mod. the issue still there.

I'm change the KSP directory and check read only the issue still there.

AppData\LocalLow\Squad\Kerbal Space Program\ no output.log file created

 

First, there is no “output.log” in 1.8, so thats not a problem.

Second, did you fully delete the KSP directory before doing a clean install?  The problem with Steam is that even if you delete the game in Steam, there are still files left behind that Steam doesnt know about.  Open the file location in Steam and manually delete the entire director before doing a clean install

and this bug just affect the very first running  1.8 and 1.8.1 version. after I can get in the game ,second time change timezone to +8 and running KSP 1.8.1 everything is normal.
